title: Aubergine fritters with lemon and coriander yoghurt

ingredients.item: ½ tsp hot chilli powder (or to taste)
2 medium eggs, beaten with a fork
Small handful coriander leaves roughly chopped

instructions.step: Cut the aubergines into thin slices and spread out over a large clean surface. Sprinkle over a little salt and leave for 15 minutes, by which time dew drops will have formed on the surface of the aubergine — dab them dry with kitchen paper. Flip the slices over and repeat on the other side.
While the aubergines are ‘sweating’, make the dressing by combining the yogurt with the lemon juice and a little salt. Top with salad onions and coriander and chill until needed.
Pour enough vegetable oil into a large frying pan to a depth of roughly 1cm. Heat the oil over a medium-high heat.
Mix the chilli and saffron with the beaten egg and slowly whisk in the two flours. Finally, whisk in the sparkling water.

Dip the aubergine slices into the batter and fry for 1-2 minutes in the oil, turning over when the first side is golden. Don't overcrowd the pan, and lay the cooked slices on kitchen paper to remove any excess oil. You can either serve the fritters immediately, or make them in advance and reheat for 5 minutes in a hot oven. Serve with the yogurt dressing.
